body:
This would require:

>altering chromosomes from XY to XX

>altering all bone structure and physical structure in general

>altering sexual organs to perfectly mimic those of the sex they're changing to

>altering all hormones

>altering all general physical characteristics like growth of facial hair or balding

>altering all aging specific sexual conditions like menopause

>ability to bear children

>vocal change

>altering fat distribution

>adding perfect breasts

>altering facial characteristics

I defy you to tell me why I should not under these circumstances.

altering chromosomes from XY to XX

I defy you to tell me why I should not under these circumstances.

body: Strikingly similar to the *Ship of Theseus* paradox. If one replaces all of the parts of a ship (planks, sails, etc.) so that the ship contains no original parts... is it still the same ship? Similarly, if you replace all the parts of a man with all the parts of a woman so that there are no original parts... is it still a man? I'm in agreement with you. The person is now a woman. In fact, I wouldn't even consider them trans. Interestingly enough, there are lots of disagreements in the thread. I guess it's a paradox for a reason.
body_html: Strikingly similar to the Ship of Theseus paradox. If one replaces all of the parts of a ship (planks, sails, etc.) so that the ship contains no original parts... is it still the same ship? Similarly, if you replace all the parts of a man with all the parts of a woman so that there are no original parts... is it still a man? I'm in agreement with you. The person is now a woman. In fact, I wouldn't even consider them trans. Interestingly enough, there are lots of disagreements in the thread. I guess it's a paradox for a reason.
